etymologies: late 18th century: from French métacentre(see meta-, center)

definitions: the point of intersection between a vertical line through the center of buoyancy of a floating body such as a ship and a vertical line through the new center of buoyancy when the body is tilted, which must be above the center of gravity to ensure stability.
shortDefinitions: point of intersection between imaginary line drawn vertically through centre of buoyancy of floating vessel
